description: The European Union is contemplating accelerating its timeline for phasing out Russian liquefied natural gas imports, potentially moving faster than the initially planned 2027 deadline. This consideration follows pressure from the US and is being explored through sanctions and modifications to the RePowerEU plan.

title: Arjan Dhillon: The bard bringing Punjabi poetry to the people
Rajasthan to get 2 new Vande Bharat trains next week; check routes
Mysuru Dasara row: SC junks plea over Banu Mushtaq invite; what it said
description: The Supreme Court has upheld the Karnataka high court's decision, allowing Muslim author Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate the state-sponsored Dasara Mahotsav at the Chamundeshwari Temple in Mysuru. The court dismissed an appeal arguing that the inauguration by a Muslim would hurt Hindu religious sentiments. The decision reinforces the secular nature of state events, as emphasized by the Constitution.

title: DUSU 2025: Aryan Maan elected president; ABVP sweeps, NSUI trails
description: Delhi University’s 2025 DUSU elections concluded with ABVP’s Aryan Maan winning the President post, while the party secured three of the four key positions. Held on September 18 across 52 centres and 195 booths, the polls saw over 2.75 lakh eligible voters, with a 39.45% turnout. Key issues included campus safety, student welfare, and gender representation, reflecting the growing political engagement of Delhi University students.

title: Who is Erika Kirk, Charlie Kirk’s widow and new CEO of Turning Point USA?
description: Erika Kirk, widow of conservative activist Charlie Kirk, has been appointed Chief Executive Officer and Chair of Turning Point USA following his death earlier this month.

title: K.C. Venugopal flays Kerala govt for ‘politicising’ Lord Ayyappa
description: In a letter to Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan, Venugopal says organising Global Ayyappa Sangamam in the name of protecting faith was ‘nothing but hypocrisy’ on the part of the government

Asia Cup: Timeline of handshake row - ICC pulls up PCB over PMOA violation
description: The Asia Cup 2025 is embroiled in controversy after India's refusal to shake hands with Pakistan sparked a major standoff. The PCB demanded the removal of match referee Andy Pycroft, delaying a match against the UAE. The ICC accused PCB of protocol breaches, including unauthorised recording within the PMOA.

title: Big blow! Trump revokes sanctions waiver - why is Iran’s Chabahar port important for India?
description: The US has revoked sanctions waivers for Chabahar port, impacting India's trade and strategic ambitions. This move affects India's operation of the Shahid Beheshti terminal, crucial for trade with Afghanistan and Central Asia, and a counter to China's Gwadar Port. The decision poses a setback to India's regional connectivity initiatives.

title: Exclusive | Jaismine Lamboria's story: COVID, setbacks to World Champion!
description: Jaismine Lamboria, hailing from Bhiwani, overcame early setbacks, including a disappointing Olympic debut and health challenges, to clinch gold at the World Boxing Championships. Inspired by her family's boxing legacy, particularly her great-grandfather Hawa Singh, she shifted her focus to performance over results.

Watch: PM Modi plants a Kadamb sapling; King Charles gifted it on his birthday
description: Narendra Modi received a Kadamb sapling from King Charles III. The gift marked Modi's 75th birthday. It also celebrated Modi's 'Ek Ped Maa Ke Naam' initiative. Modi planted the sapling at his residence. Earlier, Modi gifted King Charles a Sonoma tree. The leaders discussed climate, trade, and wellness. The Kadamb tree symbolizes environmental responsibility. This act strengthens UK-India relations.

Bengaluru civic apathy continues: Another school van gets stuck in open drain
description: In Bengaluru, a school minivan carrying children got stuck in an open drain on Panathur-Bellandur road, fortunately without injuries. This incident follows a series of accidents on the same stretch, including a school bus partially toppling and other vehicles sinking into slush-filled craters.

description: President Trump is scheduled to speak with Xi Jinping to advance trade discussions and address the TikTok situation, aiming to finalize a deal involving American investors. Despite past accusations of conspiracy, Trump maintains a positive relationship with China. The leaders will also seek common ground on tariffs, as a temporary tariff-reduction deal is set to expire in November.

description: Following India's Operation Sindoor, a Lashkar-e-Taiba commander admitted severe damage to their Muridke headquarters. This admission follows similar revelations from Jaish-e-Mohammed regarding their Bahawalpur base. LeT is now fundraising, allegedly under the guise of flood relief, to rebuild the destroyed Markaz-e-Taiba camp, with Pakistan allocating PKR 4 crore for the project.

'Ex-PM conveyed gratitude': Yasin Malik's major claim on meeting Hafiz Saeed; calls case 'betrayal'
description: Yasin Malik, jailed JKLF chief, claims he met with Lashkar-e-Taiba founder Hafiz Saeed in 2006 at the request of IB, as part of a backchannel peace process. Malik alleges that then Prime Minister Manmohan Singh expressed gratitude for his efforts.

title: Fact check: Are handshakes mandatory in cricket? What does the rulebook say?
description: Former international umpire Anil Chaudhary suggests that the Pakistan Cricket Board's (PCB) recent controversies during the Asia Cup were a diversionary tactic following their loss to India. These controversies included boycott threats, disputes with ICC match referee Andy Pycroft, and a handshake disagreement with India, sparked by strained relations after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir.

DUSU 2025: Who wins? Track the last 10 presidential races
description: The DUSU Elections 2025 are witnessing a close contest between ABVP and NSUI as vote counting continues at Delhi University. Early trends show ABVP slightly ahead in key posts, with presidential candidate Aryan Maan leading. With the last decade dominated by ABVP except two NSUI wins, today’s outcome will decide whether ABVP extends its stronghold or NSUI stages a comeback.

title: ‘Rest Jasprit Bumrah against Pakistan in Super 4’: Sunil Gavaskar wants India to plan ahead for Asia Cup final
Slaps, punches and pushes: iPhone 17 frenzy turns violent at Mumbai Apple store
description: Enthusiasts in Mumbai and Delhi eagerly awaited the iPhone 17 series launch, causing long queues and a minor scuffle at the BKC Jio Centre. The new lineup, including the iPhone 17 Pro Max, boasts an A19 Bionic chip and enhanced cameras. Some customers, like Irfan, waited overnight for specific models, while others expressed concerns about security amidst the chaos.

Zomato delivery boy attacked in Bengaluru over delayed food delivery
description: In Bengaluru's Bapuji Nagar, a Zomato delivery executive was reportedly assaulted by two individuals on September 14 due to a delayed food delivery. The dispute escalated when the order arrived late, resulting in the delivery boy sustaining minor injuries. Police are awaiting a formal complaint from the victim to initiate a full investigation into the incident.

description: Mark Zandi, chief economist at Moody’s Analytics, suggests the US economy is nearing a recession due to policy missteps and speculative market behavior. description: Delhi University Student Union elections saw a calmer polling day with a slight increase in voter turnout, reaching 39.4%. While voting was largely peaceful, the NSUI accused ABVP of vote manipulation, alleging marked EVMs. ABVP refuted the claims, citing NSUI's frustration over their growing popularity. First-time voters expressed hopes for improved campus facilities and affordable transport.

‘Mahavatar Narsimha’ OTT release: When and where to watch; blockbuster mythological movie
description: Ashwin Kumar's 'Mahavatar Narsimha,' a high-grossing animated film rooted in Indian mythology, is set to stream on Netflix. The film, based on the Vishnupurana and other Puranas, tells the story of Bhakta Prahlad and Lord Vishnu's Narsimha avatar.

title: Man throws chilli powder in his daughter’s eyes, later stabs her to death
description: In Gwalior's Janakganj, a shocking incident unfolded as Badam Singh Kushwaha allegedly murdered his 24-year-old daughter, Rani Kushwaha. Police reports indicate that Singh, fueled by a long-standing family dispute and alcohol addiction, attacked Rani with chili powder before fatally stabbing her. The mother stated that Rani often objected to his behavior.

title: 'Was fed up, wanted to take sanyas': Sheena Bora's childhood friend; email texts cited
description: Sheena Bora, allegedly murdered by Indrani Mukerjea, expressed a desire for 'sanyas' due to life's problems, according to a childhood friend's testimony, citing old emails. The friend, a prosecution witness, shared Bora's plans to marry Rahul Mukerjea and her strained relationship with Indrani. Communication ceased abruptly after a text about breaking up with Rahul.

title: xAI's final exam: Elon Musk tests loyalty; 24 hours to verdict
description: Elon Musk has requested xAI employees to submit detailed one-page summaries of their past accomplishments and future plans, setting a tight deadline amidst company turbulence. This demand follows Musk's pattern of employee performance reviews across his ventures.

title: Gemini achieves coding milestone; CEO Sundar Pichai celebrates; big leap
description: Google's Gemini 2.5 Deep Think achieved a gold-medal performance at the 2025 International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC) World Finals, solving 10 out of 12 problems. The AI tool even cracked a problem that no human team could solve, demonstrating a significant leap in abstract problem-solving. If ranked, Gemini would have secured 2nd place overall in the prestigious competition.
